sentence: Veeva Systems Inc. ( VEEV ) reported adjusted earnings of 7 cents per share in the third quarter of fiscal 2015, in line with the Zacks Consensus Estimate and up 40% from the year-ago quarter.
Total revenue surged 52% on a year-over-year basis to $83.8 million, beating the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $79 million.

Revenues from the Subscription division soared 58% year over year to $61.4 million on the back of improved performance across all product lines and extended use of multi-channel Customer Relationship Management (CRM) by customers.
Revenues from the Professional services division surged 40% to $22.4 million, primarily towing to an impressive increase in the number of Vault R&D services projects.
Along with it, achievement of certain project milestones also supported the upside.
On a geographical basis, 55% of the total revenue came from North America.
Adjusted gross margin expanded 270 basis points (bps) to 64.4%, primarily attributed to significant growth in both the Subscription and Services segments.
Adjusted sales and marketing expense, as a percentage of revenues, contracted 380 bps to 16.9%.
Adjusted research and development expense went down 30 bps to 12.8%.
On the other hand, adjusted general and administrative expense expanded 10 bps to 10.2%.
Adjusted operating expenses, as percentage of revenues contracted 390 bps on a year-over-year basis to 40%.
Adjusted operating margin expanded 660 bps to 24.4%, driven by strong top-line growth and the subsequent expansion of gross margin.
Cash and cash equivalents, as of Oct 31, 2014, was $132.1 million compared with $140.1 million at the end of the previous quarter.
Net cash provided by operating activities totaled $34.3 million, which highlighted a considerable improvement from $16.6 million reported in the preceding quarter.
Veeva Systems expects total revenue in the range of $84.5--$85.5 million for the fourth quarter of fiscal 2015.
Non-GAAP operating income is expected between $22 million and $23 million.
Non-GAAP fully diluted net income per share, as per management's guidance, is likely to be in the $0.08--$0.09 band.
For fiscal 2015, total revenue is expected in the range of $310.7-$311.7 million.
Meanwhile, non-GAAP operating income is projected in the $83.1--$84.1 million band while non-GAAP net income per share is anticipated between $0.33 and $0.34.
Veeva posted a decent fiscal third quarter with revenues improvement and a strong show by the Subscription and Services divisions.
The company's CRM experienced healthy growth and the non-CRM product lines are also starting to contribute to the overall business.
We believe Veeva vault, the cloud-based content management solution, holds substantial long-term prospects.
However, management expects service revenues to decline in the fourth quarter owing to unfavorable project timings.
Notably, in the third quarter, Veeva Systems employed in large numbers, which is expected to impact the operating margin in the next quarter.
Veeva Systems faces stiff competition from the likes of IMS Health Holding, Inc ( IMS ), Informatica Corp ( INFA ) and Oracle Corp ( ORCL ), which we believe is headwind.
